revisions.rev:
{{Infobox tvseason | image = | season_name = Casualty'' series 14 | show_name = ''[[Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]]'' | bgcolour = #66BBFF | fgcolour = #ffffff | dvd_release_date = Unknown | country = [[United Kingdom]] | network = [[BBC]] | first_aired = {{Start date|1999|9|18|df=y}} | last_aired = {{End date|2000|3|25|df=y}} | num_episodes = 30 | prev_series = [[Casualty (series 13)|13]] | next_series = [[Casualty (series 15)|15]] }} The fourteenth series of the [[United Kingdom|British]] [[medical drama]] [[television series]] ''[[Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]]'' commenced airing in the United Kingdom on BBC One on 18 September 1999 and finished on 25 March 2000. [http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0096555/episodes#season-14 IMDB Casualty Series 14] It saw another increase, this time to 30 episodes.


==Cast== *[[Derek Thompson (actor)|Derek Thompson]] as Charlie Fairhead *[[Ian Bleasdale]] as Josh Griffiths *[[Cathy Shipton]] as Lisa "Duffy" Duffin *[[Robert Gwilym]] as Max Gallagher *[[Claire Goose]] as Tina Seabrook *[[Barbara Marten]] as Eve Montgomery (Episodes 1-8) *[[Jan Anderson (actress)|Jan Anderson]] as Chloe Hill *[[Gerald Kyd]] as Sean Maddox *[[Pal Aron]] as Adam Osman *[[Donna Alexander]] as Penny Hutchens *[[Rebecca Wheatley]] as Amy Howard *[[Jonathan Kerrigan]] as Sam Colloby (Episodes 1-5) *[[Vincenzo Pellegrino]] as Derek "Sunny" Sunderland (Episodes 1-7) *[[Sandra Huggett]] as Holly Miles *[[Ronnie McCann]] as Barney Woolfe (Episode 12 onwards) *[[Ian Kelsey]] as Patrick Spiller (Episodes 15 onwards) *[[Tobias Menzies]] as Frank Gallagher (Episodes 18-23) *[[Kwame Kwei-Armah]] as Finlay "Fin" Newton (Episode 9 onwards) *[[Michelle Butterly]] as Melanie "Mel" Dyson (Episode 9 onwards) *[[Ben Keaton]] as Spencer (Episodes 16 and 18) *[[Sam Barriscale]] as Reuben Hurst (Appears in Episode 18) *[[Morag Siller]] as Leona (Various) *[[Susan Cookson]] as Julie Day (Various) *Susan Cookson later returned to Casualty in Series 19 (2004â2005) where she played Registrar Maggie Coldwell until the end of Series 22 in (2008) *Ben Keaton makes his first appearance as Spencer in Series 14 in which he is a drunk alcoholic causing mayhem in reception. By the time of Series 15 (2000â2001), Spencer has given up the drink and works as a porter in the department until the final episode of Series 16 in (2002) after which he was never seen again.
